title: Rebozo, 1901–50
medium:
Medium: cotton, silk
Technique: warp resist dyed prior to weaving (jaspe); warp-faced plain weave
provenance:
Charles F. Iklé
Charles F. Iklé
ex-collection Charles F. Iklé.
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 159 x 61.5 cm (5 ft. 2 5/8 in. x 24 3/16 in.)
description: Shawl of blue and red stripes with narrow blue and white "jaspeado" bands. Warp selvage at one end. Warp fringe at the other end has been knotted with silk added at the end of each red stripe. Knotted sections form tabs of various widths. Note use of red weft.

tombstone.epitaph:
Rebozo, 1901–50.
1901–50. Medium: cotton, silk
Technique: warp resist dyed prior to weaving (jaspe); warp-faced plain weave. Gift of Charles Iklé. 1976-112-2.
